page.title: 05Health in Penn Area
page.content: The Penn childrens and geriatric hospital cares for young and old people. The geriatric hospital was opened in 1978, whilst the childrens hospital has been there since the turn of the century, having been converted from an old house. The geriatric hospital has 84 beds. There are 3 wards and each ward is divided into 4 bays with 6 beds in each. There are approximately 100 nurses who work on 3 shifts working 37 hours a week. Most of the patients come from New Cross Hospital. To them the hospital is their home, perhaps for the rest of their life. Others, like Mrs. Butcher, who we met, is there on relief stay while her son goes on holiday. Mrs. Butcher is 84, but she is still able to take part in activities at the hospital such as knitting, printing and canework.
